entry.title: Seamlessly Expand from Event Mesh to Advanced Event Mesh with Our New Export Feature
entry.content:
Have you started your event-driven journey with the Event Mesh capability in SAP Integration Suite? It's the perfect service to begin, offering direct integration with SAP S/4HANA events and a focused feature set that caters to low to moderate event volumes. It‚Äôs ideal for businesses just beginning their EDA journey.

As your EDA implementation matures and expands, you may need to handle higher event volumes, require more sophisticated eventing capabilities, or need broader landscape coverage.

We are excited to announce that you can now easily expand from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh to meet those demands. SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh is a separately priced offering that unlocks a new level of event management with powerful features, including:

  • Event Streaming: Handle massive volumes of events with advanced features like queuing, streaming, and replay.
  • Partitioned Queues: Ensure ordered processing by publishing messages with similar contexts to the same consumer.
  • Dynamic Message Routing: Automatically determine how to forward event messages within and across clusters.
  • Distributed Tracing: Trace the complete lifecycle of an event as it travels through the event mesh.
  • Flexible Deployments: Extend beyond public and private cloud environments to hybrid and on-premises broker deployments.
  • Event Management: Create, design, share, and manage various aspects of your EDA.
  • Event Monitoring and Insights: Curated dashboards, clear visualizations from historical and real-time metrics, with timely event broker notifications.

Learn more about SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh's key features and pricing here: What is Advanced Event Mesh?

Introducing "Export Configuration"

To make your transition journey smoother, we've introduced a powerful new feature directly in the Event Mesh UI: the "Export Configuration" button.

Screenshot of the Event Mesh in Integration Suite UI, featuring a new "Export Configuration" button in the top right corner

 

This new function is the first step to move to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by downloading the configuration artifacts from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite. With a single click, you can export your existing metadata ‚Äî including queues, topic subscriptions, and settings ‚Äî into a Terraform infrastructure-as-code (.tf) file.

To guide you through the expand process from Event Mesh to Advanced Event Mesh, we published a new migration guide. You can access it here: Migration from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh

How Does the Migration Work?

The new export feature is the starting point for a streamlined, five-step migration process:

  1. Export: Navigate to the Event Mesh capability in the SAP Integration Suite UI and click the new "Export Configuration" button to download your .tf file.
  2. Edit: Open the downloaded file and add the credentials for your new, empty SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh broker instance.
  3. Import: Use standard Terraform commands (init, plan, apply) to automatically provision your queues and topic subscriptions in SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh.
  4. Adapt Applications: Adjust your sender and consumer applications to connect to the new SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh endpoints. This may involve updating connection details, libraries, and topic wildcard syntax.
  5. Migrate Applications: Choose a migration strategy that fits your needs ‚Äî either a phased, application-by-application rollout or a "big bang" switchover during a maintenance window.

This new process significantly reduces the manual effort and complexity previously associated with such a migration, allowing you to focus on leveraging the advanced capabilities of your new environment.

Ready to Get Started?

Unlock the full potential of your event-driven architecture and expand to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh today.

For a complete, step-by-step guide on the entire process, please refer to our official documentation on the SAP Help Portal:

Migration from Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh

entry.title: Extending SAP Fiori with Marketplace App Features ‚Äî Tips & Pitfalls
entry.content:
Hey everyone.

I'm currently exploring ways to extend SAP Fiori apps by integrating or adding Marketplace app features, and I'd love to hear from others who have done something similar. If you've worked on extending Fiori applications ‚Äî either by using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), SAP UI5 custom components, and third-party marketplace extensions I'd like to know:

1. What approaches or tools worked best for integrating external app features into Fiori?
2. How did you handle authentication, data binding, or API integration challenges?
3. Are there any performance or UX pitfalls to watch out for when combining Fiori and marketplace extensions?
4. How do you ensure updates or upgrades don‚Äôt break your custom integrations?
5. Any best practices or lessons learned you'd share from real projects?

I'm trying to build a setup where users get a seamless experience as if Marketplace features were native to Fiori. If you've dealt with these kinds of customizations or have tips on design, architecture, or deployment, I'd really appreciate your insights!

Thanks in advance to anyone who can share experiences, code snippets, or recommendations

entry.title: Create any deliveries SAP error VL455 ‚Äì No delivery-relevant items in order
entry.content:
OSS missing entries in follow tables: VBEP -OCDQTY_BU     and  VBEP-OCDQTY_SU

The SAP error VL455 ‚Äì "No delivery-relevant items in order" typically occurs when trying to create a delivery (e.g., with transaction VL01N) for a sales order that either:
All Sales orders work until last week now the document flow block all delivery with this message VL455
In your case, you"re using:
Sales order type: SRVO
Item category: SRVU
Delivery type: LF (standard delivery, often used for consignment fill-up)

No values in table 

The fields are VBEP -OCDQTY_BU     and  VBEP-OCDQTY_SU
Before we go to create a Delivery the document flow is set to Complete (BESTK =C)
 
After debug we fund that the date have been changing and the schedule line had a error.  Delivery are created for Sales order 1026  

Following table missing entries: The fields are VBEP -OCDQTY_BU     and  VBEP-OCDQTY_SU

entry.title: Second Half 2025 Release: What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile
entry.content:
Welcome to the next era of mobile HR! Our latest SuccessFactors Mobile release is packed with innovations designed to make your work life smoother, smarter, and more personalized than ever before. Whether you‚Äôre an employee, manager, these updates are crafted to empower you every step of the way.

 

Mobile Homepage: Your Work, Your Way  

Say hello to a unified, customizable mobile homepage! Now available as an opt-in for both mobile and web, this new experience brings: 

  • A vibrant, customizable splash screen for creative branding. 
  • A consistent header across iOS and Android for seamless navigation. 

‚ÄÉ

  • A redesigned Profile & Settings screen that puts key information and configuration options right at your fingertips. 
  • A completely rebuilt To-Do screen with powerful filtering‚Äîorganize and prioritize tasks like never before.  

People Profile Experience: Full Control, Full View 

The latest Mobile People Profile update gives you a consolidated Full Profile view and more autonomy over your data. Edit mode allows you to decide when and how to update your information. Full Profile View and Edit are both Opt-Out. Enjoy unified access to: 

  • Full Profile View, including User Information, Pension Payout, and Talent Trends. 
  • Effortless editing of Job Relationships. 
  • Additional enhancements like showing login names in profile previews, hiding categories for contingent workers, and supporting ‚ÄúSave to Contacts‚Äù directly from the profile. 

Joule Enhancements: Smarter Assistance for Everyone 

Joule just got a major upgrade! Now, employees can: 

  • Request leave or half-day absences directly in a conversational way. 
  • Instantly check leave balances‚Äîannual, sick, or any type‚Äîright from the app.
  • Add "Know the time-off rules and submit your leave request in under a minute."

Managers, get ready for a game-changer: 

  • Access performance and goals agents, reducing prep time by up to 75%. 
  • Focus on strategic work, not data digging. 
  • Create and execute actionable plans with all the right information at your fingertips. 

Plus, everyone can now submit feedback to help Joule get even better‚Äîthumbs up, thumbs down, and detailed comments are all welcome! 

New Learning Experience: Empowering Your Growth 

Continuous development is now easier than ever. Our enhanced learning tools support self-directed learning paths and deliver timely updates, so you can invest in yourself and your team‚Äôs growth‚Äîanytime, anywhere: support for optional curricula (self-assigned or admin/manager assigned) and improved integration with Open Content Network courses.

Geofencing for Mobile CICO: Clock In Where It Counts 

Compliance and employee experience just got a boost! With geofencing, users can only clock in or out when they‚Äôre within their designated work location. Define job sites, set boundaries, and give employees clarity on where they can record their time. 

Flexible Time Sheets: Work Smarter with Less Clicks 

Efficiency is the name of the game: 

  • Manage time sheets in various periods - such as monthly, bi-weekly, or weekly.

  • Copy-paste time sheet entries across multiple days - no more repetitive data entry. 

Effortless Half-Day Absences  

Clock time employees can now record half-day absences with ease. The system automatically aligns absences with planned working times and breaks, offering simple options (First Half / Second Half) and the flexibility to customize as needed. 

Org Chart Updates: Visual and Configurable 

Make your org charts work for you! Configure fields like photo and location to create more informative, visually engaging org charts that reflect your organization‚Äôs unique structure. 

Global Assignment & Concurrent Employment: Seamless Multi-Role Management 

Managing multiple assignments or employments? Now you can select which profile or assignment to use, manage data instantly, and take action for selected employment.

People Search Result Navigation: Direct & Consistent 

Find who you need, faster. Access profiles directly from search results, reducing unnecessary steps and ensuring a consistent experience across platforms. 

Why this Matters 

This release is a leap forward in usability, personalization, and operational efficiency. Every innovation is designed to make your SuccessFactors Mobile experience more intuitive, productive, and enjoyable. 


For more details please check the release notes here.

If you have questions, please leave them in the comments below, or ask them in the SAP SuccessFactors Mobile Forum.

Experience greater efficiency and enhanced performance by downloading the latest version of SAP SuccessFactors Mobile through the Apple App Store, Google Play Store, or Tencent App Store.

It's important to note that as of November 2025, the app will no longer support iOS 17.X on iPhone/iPad and Android 10.X. For more details, please refer to SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App to Deprecate Support for Apple iOS 17.X in November 2025 and SAP SuccessFactors Mobile App to Deprecate Support for Android 10.X in November 2025.


SAP SuccessFactors Mobile is a native app, which is available on iOS as well as on Android. It provides employees and managers access to HR activities anywhere at any time. The app is free of charge and can be used by every SAP SuccessFactors customer.

entry.title: How to write change pointers into MDGD_CP when a Z-table is updated (for DRFOUT Change Mode)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I'm currently working on a scenario where I want to send Material master data (BO=194) from S/4HANA to SAP Digital Manufacturing (DM) using DRFOUT in ‚ÄúChange Mode‚Äù, which is scheduled to run every 10 minutes.

Here is the situation:
„ÉªWhen I execute DRFOUT manually in Change Mode, it successfully retrieves data from the related Z-table, includes it in the IDoc, and sends it to DM without any issue.
„ÉªWhen the Z-table is updated, entries are correctly written to CDHDR/CDPOS and BDCP2.
„ÉªHowever, DRFOUT only generates IDocs when corresponding entries exist in MDGD_CP.
„ÉªTherefore, I would like to ensure that whenever the Z-table is updated, a change pointer is also written to MDGD_CP.
„ÉªI'm considering using the BAdI BDCP_BEFORE_WRITE to insert records into MDGD_CP at the same time as ALE change pointers are written.

My questions are:
„ÉªIs this approach (using BDCP_BEFORE_WRITE to create entries in MDGD_CP) technically valid?
„ÉªIf entries are successfully created in MDGD_CP, can DRFOUT in Change Mode pick them up and generate the IDoc automatically?
„ÉªAre there any additional steps or configuration required to make this linkage work properly?

Any insights, examples, or experience regarding this setup would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance,
Koichi Okamoto

entry.title: Re: üü† Agentic Coding with CAP
entry.content:
Hi David,

Would this support creating AI agents for building an Agentic AI application using CAP? One of the challenges we currently face with Agentic AI applications in SAP is the dependency on Python-based frameworks such as LangChain, LangGraph, and SDKs like Strand for agent creation. Does this address that by enabling agent development within CAP, or is it primarily designed to expose CAP application as MCP and act as an assistant available locally to help developers create CAP applications from scratch without requiring deep expertise in CAP programming? What are the benefits of using this as compared to using say, Microsoft CoPilot, SAP Joule, Amazon Q for Developers, etc?

Regards,
Aditi Dey

entry.title: Re: Crystal reports + zebra cut options
entry.content: the driver placed on the printserver, we've fixed it for now using Report Runner, but other potential solutions are welcome. They print from an ERP solution, labelsformat is created in Crystal Reports. The amount of labels will be set by the user at printing, this is one print job with several labels in it. It should cutting after the last label/page, but it cuts after every label.

entry.title: Re: Incorrect Invoice Header Data Copied from Another Doc...
entry.content:
These type of issues would predominantly due to custom logic. Not sure, which user exit is implemented in your system. Normally, it would be USEREXIT_FILL_VBRK_VBRP or BADI_SD_CUST_HEAD or BADI_SD_BILLING. Here, set breakpoints or use logging to trace how VBRK-KUNAG and VBRK-KUNRG are populated during VF04. Review shared variables or buffers in custom code for proper clearing/resetting.

Having said that, the recommended fix would be refactor custom code to avoid global variables or ensure they are cleared at the start of each invoice loop. Use local variables within loops to isolate data per invoice. Implement proper partner determination logic using standard SAP routines unless customization is absolutely necessary. Test VF04 in a sandbox with logging enabled to reproduce and isolate the issue.

entry.title: Exploring Business Partner Master Data with SAP Joule, the AI Co-pilot
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs ever-evolving business landscape, quick access to business partners and their specific details is crucial for success. But this can be tedious and time-consuming when you have a lot of master data objects, especially when you want to quickly fetch some specific information related to a section of the master data without having to open the FIORI app and click through multiple facets in the user interface to locate the required information.

With the latest update of SAPJoule in October 2025, Business Partner master data brings you the power of AI. With Joule's robust functionality, you can easily access and view detailed information about your Business Partners, enhancing your ability to make informed decisions and streamline operations. This blog post explores how Joule can become your go-to assistant for easily accessing Business Partners efficiently.

 

A Closer Look at Business Partners

Joule offers features that allow users to delve into various aspects of Business Partner data. With Joule, you can explore:

  • Overview: Quickly access a summary of key information about your Business Partners.
  • Basic Details: Review fundamental data points, including organisation title and identifying search terms.
  • Roles: Understand the roles your Business Partners fulfil and their associated descriptions.
  • Addresses: Examine details of maintained and standard addresses across regions.
  • Industries: Gain insights into the industry classifications of your Business Partners.
  • Relationships: Explore the interconnected web of relationships between your Business Partners.

 

Joule‚Äôs Requirements

Before diving into Joule's capabilities, ensure you meet the prerequisites for access. You must be assigned the business role: SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST to leverage Joule.

 

Practical Use Cases for Business Partners

Display Business Partner Overview

Kickstart your exploration by asking Joule to show you an overview of a Business Partner. For instance, entering the Joule prompt, "Display Business Partner Overview" followed by specifying an ID such as ‚Äú10238179‚Äù, will yield an informative card with essential details like Full Name, Business Partner ID, Category, and Communication Details.

 

Joule knows what else you might need

You read that right! Joule right away brings up the relevant supported details of the business partner in the form of quick links.

 

All that you must do is click any of the navigational links to view the corresponding details of the business partner. Everything in the same conversation window with Joule!

Joule also provides you with the navigation to the app where the business partner is stored. With just a click, you can open the object to view all its details or edit it to make changes.

Now let‚Äôs speed up things. What if you don‚Äôt want to go step by step. You know the business partner's number, and you quickly want to view some specific information. Well, Joule does that too!

 

Dive into Basic Details

To uncover foundational insights, ask Joule, "Show me basic data of business partner 10238179." This query retrieves critical information, including Authorization Group and Archiving Flags.

Unveiling Roles

Discover the various roles a Business Partner plays in your organisation by requesting Joule to "Display roles of business partner 10238179." Learn about the roles, their descriptions, and their validity periods.

 

Navigating Addresses

Addresses are pivotal in maintaining smooth communication. By querying "Display addresses of business partner 10238179," you can access all address entries and their specifics, ensuring that communication remains seamless.

Industry Insights

To understand the industry dynamics, ask Joule to ‚ÄúFor BP 10238179, show me industry details‚Äù. This reveals the Business Partner‚Äôs industry designations and systems.

Exploring Relationships

The intricate network of relationships is crucial for operational success. Joule can help display all related business partners by querying "Display relationship of BP 10238179," providing insights into all maintained relationships. Furthermore, for each related business partner, Joule reveals the Relationship Category, validity, and associated fields based on the relationship category.

 

Practical Use Cases for Customer Master Data

Display Customer Overview

Initiate your exploration of customer master data by querying an overview. Simply start with "Show me customers overview," and specify a Customer ID such as ‚Äú1007885‚Äù for detailed insights. Joule retrieves essential information like full name, Customer ID, and contact details.

 

It works the same way as that of Business Partner. Quick links help you fetch more relevant details about the Customer master data.

 

Navigate Customer Information

Dive further with specific queries like, "Show me customer information for 1023060," to uncover details such as account group, authorization group, order block, and classification indicators.

Exploring Sales Area Dynamics

To view a customer‚Äôs sales area specifics, ask Joule, "Display sales area of customer 1023060." For further exploration into individual sales areas, a query such as "Display sales area details of customer 1023060 with sales area 1010 10 00" reveals insights like sales office locations, shipping condition, and payment terms.

Tax Data Delve

Tax considerations are crucial. By querying, "Display tax data of customer 1023060 with sales area 1010 10 00," you can access location-specific tax classifications and descriptions.

 

Financial Engagement: Company Code and Dunning

Explore financial coordination by asking Joule for company code details, with queries like "Display company code of customer 1023060." At the same time, examining dunning data can optimize collections ‚Äì ‚ÄúDisplay dunning data of customer 1023060 with company code 4040" provides detailed procedural insights.

 

Conclusion

With this update, you can leverage Joule to access Business Partner and Customer objects. You can soon expect Joule for Supplier objects too.

Empower your business with Joule's capabilities and streamline your operations by effectively accessing Business Partner information. Whether it‚Äôs for ensuring precise communication or gaining industry insights, Joule stands ready to assist.

Embark on your journey with Joule today and redefine how you effectively access business partner and customer master data for success.

entry.title: Re: Issue with VAT Calculation in Asset Retirement via F-...
entry.content:
Good day @AlvaroFernandezMorales 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Post Retirement (Integrated AR) ‚Äì With Customer, Manage G/L Account Master Data

Tax Configuration Options for Key Users, Scope Items for Asset Accounting

To summarise, the scenario you described about system posting the asset sale to the customer account but no VAT line appearing even though a tax code is entered when you use Post Retirement with Customer app is common in public cloud.

The VAT not appearing during asset sale posting is caused by the revenue account not being tax relevant. I recommend you set Tax Category = Output Tax Allowed on that account and ensure that your VAT code is valid. Not that the system automatically calculates and posts the correct tax when performing an asset retirement with the customer.

Steps to consider are: (See further guidance below)

  • Use the Post Retirement (Integrated AR) ‚Äì With Customer app.
  • Ensure your revenue account allows output tax.
  • Repost it and VAT will be correctly calculated and shown in the journal entry.

 

Use the Post Retirment-With Customer app

Fill out the Asset number, customer, amount, and VAT code. Then proceed to show output Tax.

Go to Manage G/L Account Master Data √† Choose the Accounts √† Company Code Data √† Highlight Tax Category = Output Tax Allowed

Next, search for Automatic Account Determination. Then show mapping between Asset Class √† Transaction Key √† Revenue G/L

Then, search for Manual Journal Entries App. Display the final document with Customer, Revenue, and Output Tax lines.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: What is correct set up of Rebate sales condition type...
entry.content:
Why RES1 appears in RVAA01 instead of REA1 is because, in S/4HANA, the classic rebate processing (using REA1 and VBOX) is deprecated in favor of Settlement Management using Condition Contracts. RES1 is designed to accrue rebate amounts during billing (in RVAA01) and used again during settlement (in A10005) to calculate the final rebate amount. REA1 is not included in standard pricing procedures like RVAA01 or A10005 in S/4HANA because it belongs to the older rebate framework.

RVAA01: RES1 is used to accrue rebate amounts during billing. These accruals are posted to financial accounting.

A10005: RES1 is used again to calculate the final settlement amount during condition contract settlement (WB2R_SC or WB2R_SV).

entry.title: Re: Automatic accrual creation
entry.content: @ArunSuresh3 it's a annual accrual frequency. But it's a Time Account Type with flexible start date that corresponds to the employee's hire date anniversary. This means that almost every day an accrual should run automatically for someone.

entry.title: How to extend or disable password lifetime for SAP Datasphere database user?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm currently accessing SAP Datasphere data from Google BigQuery using a Datasphere database user. Everything works fine, but I‚Äôve run into an issue with password expiration.

The database user‚Äôs password expires every 90 days, which causes my BigQuery jobs to fail until I manually:

  1. Reset the password in SAP Datasphere, and

  2. Update the connection details in BigQuery.

I tried checking in the SAP HANA Cockpit (linked to the Datasphere tenant) to modify the password lifetime parameter, but it seems I don‚Äôt have permission or the option to change it.

My questions are:

  • Is there a way for me to set or extend the password lifetime for this database user?

  • Or is this something that SAP must configure on their end for managed tenants?

Any guidance or experience from others who have faced the same issue would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

entry.title: Preparation Cerification SAC
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I‚Äôm currently preparing for the C_SAC_2501 exam, and I have some doubts about a few questions. Please, I would really appreciate your help to better understand the correct answer to each question.


You have a dimension with members for product groups and products. Each product group has associated products. You want to plan by product group without disaggregating into the products.

How can you do this?

Disable allocations
Use two properties
Disable distribution
Use two hierarchies


You are creating a new public version. Which categories can you use?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Forecast
Budget
Predictive
Actual
You are creating a script for an advanced data action. Which character designates a virtual variable member?

%
/
#
.


You have a story in My Files. You want your colleague to review and comment on the story. What must you do?

Create a Review task for the story
Add a Comment widget to the story
Include the story in a Discussion
Share with View access


What can you do to reduce the data refresh time when opening a story? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

Avoid tables with more than 500 rows and 60 columns
Load widgets in the background
Avoid prompts
Use responsive pages
Use conditional formatting


You have a live data model with two dimensions: Firstname and Lastname. Users want a single dimension in the data model that displays the dimensions as Lastname, Firstname.

What must you do?

Create the combined data in the source system data model.
Create a calculated dimension in the story.
Create a dimension in the live data model.
Group the Firstname and Lastname in the data model.

 


You have a story based on an import model. The transaction data in the model's data source changes.

How can you update the data in the model?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Refresh the import job
Schedule the import
Allow model import
Refresh the story


You have a dataset that extracts data from an SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) system. The data in the SAP BW system changes. How can you update the dataset?

You must refresh the story that uses the dataset.
You must manually reimport the data.
You can schedule the dataset to update on a regular basis.
You must create a new dataset.


Which SAP Analytics Cloud feature uses natural language processing?

Smart insight
Data analyzer
Digital boardroom
Just Ask feature


Which automatically created dimension type can you delete from an analytic data model?

Date
Generic
Version
Organization

entry.title: Re: Launch your Data Science Platform with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

Nice, the same even can be done with native, enterprise databricks. or evey community edition. With FedML. Point is clear, views not tables. I have tested the funtionality with local tables and it works but not remote tables replicated for example from S/4HANA.

However, in my view the direction should be the SAP BDC connect(for production grade deployments) for Azure/Databricks since it is bi-directional with zero-copy delta share all the way to Unity Catalog that can be consumed directly by Azure infrastructure. Thus, briding the gap between both the worlds SAP and Azure ecosystem for organizations. 

Cheers, Happy blogging.

Since this blog has been around for over 5 years, I am wondering if the extension ledger restrictions are still valid for the new S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025 system.
Unfortunately, I couldn't find the listed extension ledger restrictions (No postings to vendor or customer reconciliation accounts, No postings to GL accounts with open item items management, No integration with Asset Accounting and Only very few automatic processes work with extension ledger (GL allocations)) in our SAP Help Portal (link Extension Ledger Types | SAP Help Portal) or in any SAP Note.
I was only able to find information regarding the "Extension ledger is not available in the ledger field when creating an assessment cycle for overhead costs in 'Manage Allocations'" restriction (https://me.sap.com/notes/3630370/E).

Friederike

entry.title: Why are some sales documents missing in app Manage Sales Order?
entry.content:
Some SD documents that are available in app "List of sales orders VA05", are missing in the ‚ÄúManage Sales Orders‚Äù app ‚Äî why is this happening?

How can I display all sales documentsÔºü


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Why are some sales documents missing in app Manage Sa...
entry.content:
Ensure the sales documents searched for are really Sales Orders and not; e.g. Customer Return documents of Document category H. Manage Sales Orders only works with sales documents of doc category - C; i.e. sales orders. VA05 is a different app completely and doesn't use the same filtering process or CDS views. 

A list of alternative options for sales orders, credit memo requests, etc can be found within the SAP Help documentation or FIORI Apps Library.

Additional Details

  • We recommend that you use the List Sales Orders Without Charge (F7672) app to search for sales orders without charge and display them in the list.
  • We recommend that you use the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app to change multiple sales documents at a time.
  • To list returns orders, you can use the Manage Customer Returns - Version 2 (F4832) app and the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app.
  • To list credit memo requests, you can use the Manage Credit Memo Requests - Version 2 (F1989A) app and the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app.
  • To list debit memo requests, you can use the Manage Debit Memo Requests - Version 2 (F1988A) app and the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app

 

Below is a list of Sales documents and their corresponding document category:

A Inquiry
B Quotation
C Order
D Item Proposal
E Scheduling Agreement
F Scheduling Agreement with External Service Agent
G Contract
H Returns
I Order Without Charge
J Delivery
K Credit Memo Request
L Debit Memo Request
M Invoice
N Invoice Cancellation
O Credit Memo
P Debit Memo

entry.title: Re: WIP source type "N - Costs Not to Be Included" doesn'...
entry.content:
Hello again,
Finally, SAP solved this issue,
Even though WIP source account is type "N - Costs Not to Be Included", when adding entry in "Assign WIP Accounts" it is not possible to add entry blank. It is necessary to maintain same accounts as the other entries and then save. WIP assigned accounts will disappear and then it is already possible to save changes into a transport request.
Weird solution but it works.
Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Reading Messages from PI System
entry.content:
• version: The number of the message version to read. Use -1 to read the newest version, or a number larger/equal 0 to read older versions. E.g. if there are 4 message versions existing, valid values are 0, 1, 2 and -1. Please note that 3 isn‚Äôt a valid value in this example, since -1 has to be used to read the newest message version.

No matter the version I use, always donwloads the same payload, the latest one.

Anyone faced this issue? Is it a patch level issue?

entry.title: Fetch Request token or ID Token from OAuth Grant Code Authentication
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are doing integration with OpenText system via SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration. OpenText accepts only ID_Token to authenticate. We have an App which is registered in the Microsoft Azure and we generated the Client Credentials in the App. We use the microsoft login OAuth API initially to get the Access, Refresh and ID_Token and then use this ID_token to authenticate and call other OpenText API's. 

The solution is possible if I generate the refresh token in POSTMAN then use it in my Stored artifacts to generate another refresh token everytime. But I want to make this dynamic. 

I used the function getAccesTokenForOauth2AuthorizationCodeCredential to get the Access Token, but this does not return me the Refresh Token or ID_Token which is available along with the Access_Token. I tried to use the authentication using POSTMAN and the response JSON contains all these Tokens. Is there another way to get the all Tokens? Does SAP has another function with supports this? This is a critical factor for one of our integrations with OpenText which only accepts ID_Token containing the User Context.

entry.title: Debugging ‚Äúunsupported_grant_type‚Äù in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration ‚Äî A Complete Walkthrough
entry.content:
Author: Ayush Aggarwal
*SAP Integration Developer | Building Reliable SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration Interfaces | Passionate about Real-World Problem Solving

üß† Introduction

If you‚Äôve ever integrated SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration with an on-prem OAuth token service, you‚Äôve probably seen this frustrating response at least once:

{"error": "unsupported_grant_type"}

It looks like a backend issue ‚Äî but in my case, the real problem was layered across Cloud Integration, Groovy, and the Cloud Connector.

Everything worked perfectly in Postman, yet consistently failed inside SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration.
Here‚Äôs how I diagnosed and resolved it ‚Äî step by step.

‚öôÔ∏èThe Scenario

My SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration iFlow needed to fetch an OAuth token from an on-premise endpoint (hosted on Microsoft IIS / ASP.NET) through the SAP Cloud Connector.

The expected request looked like this:

POST /token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=password&
username=API_USER&
password=MySecurePassword123!&
oauth_bearer_secret=AbCdEfGhIjKlMnOpQrStUvWxYz123456$CF)J@NcRf&
ip=192.168.0.10

In Postman, this returned a valid token instantly.
But from SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration, the response was always:

{"error": "unsupported_grant_type"}

üîçStep 1 ‚Äì Verifying Headers and Cloud Connector Path

The first thing I checked was the HTTP Request Headers in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration trace (Before HTTP Adapter).
To my surprise, it only showed Cloud Connector‚Äìrelated headers:

SAP-Connectivity-ConsumerAccount
SAP-Connectivity-SCC-Location_ID
SAP-PASSPORT

No Content-Type, no Accept.
That meant the backend wasn‚Äôt even treating my payload as a form submission ‚Äî it was likely ignoring the body completely.

üß† Step 2 ‚Äì Encoding and Header Configuration

Next, I added a Groovy Script before the HTTP adapter to URL-encode all fields safely:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import java.net.URLEncoder

def Message processData(Message message) {
    def props = message.getProperties()
    def enc = { v -> URLEncoder.encode(v ?: "", "UTF-8") }

    def body = "grant_type=${enc(props.get('Grant_type'))}" +
               "&username=${enc(props.get('User'))}" +
               "&password=${enc(props.get('Password'))}" +
               "&oauth_bearer_secret=${enc(props.get('Secret'))}" +
               "&ip=${enc(props.get('IP'))}"

    message.setHeader("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
    message.setHeader("Accept", "application/json")
    message.setBody(body)
    return message
}

Still no luck ‚Äî the same error persisted.

üïµÔ∏è Step 3 ‚Äì The ‚ÄúAha!‚Äù Moment: HTTP Method Was GET

After a few more trace analyses, I finally spotted the culprit:
My HTTP adapter was configured to use GET, because we were ‚Äújust fetching a token.‚Äù

But OAuth token endpoints must always use POST.

Why?
Because they only parse grant_type, username, and password from the body, not from the query string.

Changing the method to POST immediately changed the server‚Äôs behavior ‚Äî the request started reaching the backend handler correctly.

‚ö†Ô∏èStep 4 ‚Äì Another Twist: Groovy GString Conversion Error

Just when I thought it was fixed, SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration threw a new error:

org.apache.camel.InvalidPayloadException:
No type converter available to convert from type GStringImpl to InputStream

This happens because Groovy‚Äôs string interpolation ("${variable}") produces a GString, not a plain String ‚Äî
and the HTTP adapter can‚Äôt automatically convert it into an InputStream.

The fix?
Convert the body to a plain String explicitly before setting it:

message.setBody(body.toString())

That single .toString() solved the conversion issue once and for all.

üéâStep 5 ‚Äì Success!

After redeploying with:

  • HTTP Method: POST

  • Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

  • Body: body.toString()

‚Ä¶the flow finally returned a 200 OK and a valid token JSON üéØ

üßæ Summary of Root Causes

Layer Issue Fix

SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration ConfigurationMethod was set to GETChange to POST
Groovy ScriptBody was a GStringImplUse .toString()
Cloud ConnectorContent-Type wasn‚Äôt passed earlierRe-add header right before HTTP adapter

üß† Key Learnings for SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration Developers

‚úÖAlways use POST when requesting OAuth tokens ‚Äî GET requests won‚Äôt parse the body.
‚úÖConvert Groovy interpolated strings to Java strings using .toString().
‚úÖSet Content-Type explicitly as application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
‚úÖRead the trace logs carefully ‚Äî the ‚ÄúBefore HTTP Adapter‚Äù payload is your truth source.
‚úÖDon‚Äôt assume that Postman and SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration behave the same ‚Äî even identical payloads can differ in transport semantics.

üì∑Screenshots

  • SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration HTTP Receiver Adapter configuration

  • 404 Error

  • Successful token response in trace

üí¨Conclusion

This issue was a reminder that in integration, 99% of ‚Äúbackend errors‚Äù come from how we send the data, not the data itself.

After hours of debugging, the fix turned out to be:

  • One configuration change (POST instead of GET)

  • One line of code (body.toString())

Sometimes, the smallest details make the biggest difference.

 

üë§About the Author

Ayush Aggarwal is an SAP Integration Developer with expertise in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration, Cloud Connector, and data integrations across SAP and cloud platforms.
He enjoys sharing practical, real-world lessons learned from deep debugging scenarios to help fellow developers save time and effort.

entry.title: SAP B1 Web Client 2508
entry.content: In SAP Business One 10.0 FP 2508 (Web Client), is there a built-in pop-up control for selecting multiple values (e.g., multiple items or partners) in a form? If not, can a custom pop-up (modal) be created programmatically via the Web Client extension framework or Service Layer?

entry.title: SAP on IBM i Webcast: A new paradigm for <sid>ADM - not just for IBM i 7.6
entry.content:
<sid>ADM is the main user profile on IBM i to administer an SAP system at the operating system level. Sharing the password of <sid>ADM among multiple system administrators is sometimes done at customer sites but is not desired. Also, if you are running IBM i 7.6 and want to benefit from the enhanced security of multi-factor authentication (MFA) for <sid>ADM, limitations in remote file systems make it difficult. In the upcoming SAP on IBM i webcast, we will present a new SAP tool to allow SAP system administrators to sign on with their own user profiles - optionally in IBM i 7.6 with MFA - and then easily switch to <sid>ADM to perform administration tasks on their SAP systems.

The webcast is scheduled for November 18th, 2025, at 4 pm CET, 10 am EST, 8:30 pm IST. Please visit the website at   to register for the webcast. In reply, you will receive a calendar entry to your email address with all the information that you need to join the webcast.

As usual, questions are welcome during the session. Some general Q&A time is also reserved at the end of the webcast for general questions and for your suggestions about possible topics for future webcasts.

If you can‚Äôt make the live session, a replay will be made available for registrants.

We hope to see you there!

entry.title: Cash Report SQL Query
entry.content:
Hello dear SAP experts!

I need standart SAP B1 Cash Report(Financials > Financial Reports > Financial > Cash Report) report's SQL . Where can I find this query text?

Thanks in advance for your help.

entry.title: Cost Price of item unexpectedly zero
entry.content:
Hi,

I have an item that gets purchased and sold regularly. Valuation method is Moving Average.

All of a sudden the Cost Price is zero, but the Inventory Audit Report shows a value of 0.77 on the last row:

The only out-of-the-ordinary transaction is the last row nr. 1715. A Purchase Invoice that corrects the incorrect price that was used in the Goods Receipt P/O, row nr. 1698. The invoice was backdated.

How did the system calculate a moving average cost price of zero?

Regards,

Johan

entry.title: Wrong tax calculation in MIRO
entry.content:
Hello,

I‚Äôve noticed a 0.01 EUR difference in tax calculation during MIRO posting.

Example:
Net amount = 164.35 EUR
Tax rate = 23%
Expected tax = 37.80 EUR
SAP calculated tax = 37.81 EUR

All item prices are entered with 2 decimals (12.52, 11.55, 8.80, each with 5 units), so this doesn‚Äôt seem to be caused by item-level rounding.

Any guidance on where to check or adjust would be appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW has not mapped billing categories B and C.
entry.content:
We have an requirement to fill  E1EDP02 qualifier [001] for rebate credit notes to support with purchase order number from ‚ÄòB1 and ‚ÄòB3‚Äô billing types whose billing categories are B and C.

On checking further we could see the Billing Categories are hardcoded inside the FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW, they are filling the purchase document number i.e., BSTKD for document categories ‚ÄòA‚Äô OR ‚ÄòP‚Äô OR ‚ÄòD‚Äô OR ‚ÄòL‚Äô OR ‚ÄòI‚Äô.

And there is no code mentioned for Billing Category category ‚ÄòB‚Äô and  ‚ÄòC‚Äô to fill the purchase document number.

Our query is why Billing category B and C is not hardcoded in above standard FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW.

We have requirement to fill Purchase order number for IDOC E1EDP02 qualifier [001] for rebate credit notes B1 and B3 billing types whose billing categories B and C are not hard coded in standard FM.

Help us to know the reason why it is not mapped and how can we fulfill business requirement.

entry.title: Re: Getting Started with SAP BTP Forms Service by Adobe (On-Premise)
entry.content: Are there any help documents or blog articles that describe how to configure multiple instances of the Adobe Forms service in BTP against the same SAP environment for global high availability + redundancy during major ADS upgrades or BTP outages?
